title: (x) Looking for scripts similar to Eye Magazine logo - various {gang}
content:
Hello Typophiles  
Im after a similar logo to eye magazine. I’m guessing it’s an original hand edited creation. But is there anything similar? I love the curve of the ’e’s and I’m looking for looping ’L’s and ’o’s like in the Kelloggs logo.

It’s for my refreshed business logo (hence the change life part) :)

Thanks very much

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/eye_5592.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/kellogs_3818.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Hazlitz Bespoke Stationery striped sans - Prisma (Mirage) {Michael Albright (Rainer)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32803 "Go to previous forum topic") [Toyota Aurion font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32796 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ichad

comments.content:
Thanks. There are some very nice fonts on there. Definately good for inspiration on this logo,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/amor_4117.jpg)

although not quite what im looking for.

Is there anything with the loops in the ’Ls’?

Have a look at Radio from Thirstype

[http://www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135133/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/")
If this is for a logo, it might be best to draw this from scratch. If you don’t trust your skills (as I wouldn’t trust mine) ask an expert. It will be worth the effort for a logo that is original.

Many thanks everyone! Monoline Script is excellent and really good reference for getting my curves correct.

I spent a day drawing a rough outline (in line form) and with some tweaking and cross-reference to the above fonts mentioned I will be able to get it right.

Thanks all  
Chad
